intro: Oxytropis sivehensis, commonly known as the Siveh grassvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia, particularly Iran and Afghanistan. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis sivehensis is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
